Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I came away from this course with a much better understanding of Judaism's early stages. In particular, I learned a lot about how Judaism has both evolved and maintained its core elements.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Great class overall. Perhaps a bit more discussion could be helpful, but I honestly really enjoyed listening to Professor Fraade speak.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend this course to any student interested in Judaism. The course gave me a much-needed understanding of the roots of my own religion, and I could see the course being even more interesting for a non-Jew.

Great introduction to ancient Judaism. I didn't have any background in this area and felt quite comfortable in the class. Prof. Fraade makes himself available to answer questions twice a week--be sure to take advantage of this when you prepare the final paper! Not a difficult class, but I learned a lot,
